item.title: Report E-2024020370
item.description:
Report E-2024020370

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-15
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS regarding (2) punctured bags containing Sodium Sulfide, Hydrated that released approximately 1-cup of product onto the wooden trailer floor. The punctured occurred because of a pallet jack. A Contractor cleaned-up the spill and containerized the damaged bags and shrink wrap in (1) 55DF for waste disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by the release.

item.title: Report X-2024021011
item.description:
Report X-2024021011

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: HUTCHINS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA placed the bucket in black tub for hazmat when they realized the it was leaking. DescribePack: At first glance the bucket looks like it is in good condition until I saw a small puddle forming at the bottom. When examining the bucket, it was then when I realized it has a small hole near the bottom. The bucket will still slowly leak out the hazardous material while stand up correctly. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: It was placed in a black tub until I came around to place it in yellow drum.

  • Description: Approximately 1 gallon of Quorum Clear V, which was released from 1-55 gallon poly drum due to a pinhole at the bottom of the drum as it was loaded onto a pallet with a nail protruding from the bottom. No Drains, Soils, or Waterways were impacted.

item.title: Report E-2024020344
item.description:
Report E-2024020344

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-07
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 7, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2929 was damaged due to unknown reasons and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental & Emergency (E3) to remediate the impacted site. Crews observed the released material evaporated from the loading dock floor prior to their arrival. E3 personnel placed the damaged 5-gallon pail into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for further evaluation.

item.title: Report X-2024020894
item.description:
Report X-2024020894

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-02
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: sequence of events are unknown. Hazmat team was called to come and remove package from dock area. DescribePack: The plastic pail is busted almost half way around the circumference of the bottom of the pail. As a result, the chlorine granules began to spill out of container into the bottom of the box and eventually outside of the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a hazbag and put into a hazardous tote and brought to the HMPA for further examination.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet when unloading from the trailer. It was taken to the hazmat cage and placed in a red hazmat bin. DescribePack: Metal pail had a loose cap on its lid. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed upright and taken to the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2024020866
item.description:
Report X-2024020866

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-01
  • City: MISSOURI CITY
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found leaking during preload. Pkg may have not been facing with orientation arrows upwards The area was temporarily evacuated and absorbent mats was used to clean up the spill. At discovery, the pkg was immediately taken to the hazmat processing area. DescribePack: Leaking from top of can. No clips seen. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package handlers were told what to do when a hazmat leaks. They were retaught how to properly load hazmats with orientation arrows upwards. Absorbent mats were used for cleanup.

item.title: Report X-2024021039
item.description:
Report X-2024021039

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: AUSTIN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: It appears tape failed on the bottom of packaging. While unloading the package bottom opened up causing inner contents fall out. (1) plastic Gallon bottle of Lime-B-Gone landed with cap side down causing it to crack and spill some contents. QA was notified and removed package to Hazmat cage utilizing all appropriate PPE to include, Gloves, goggles and face mask. DescribePack: Tape on the bottom of the package gave way under the weight of items causing one of the bottles to fall on the cap causing it to crack DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Item was immediately picked up and placed upright to minimize amount of spillage.

DescribePack: There is a small crack on the bottom of the drum. This is what led to the spill. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was brought to the damaged hazmat area after being separated from other packages.

item.title: Report X-2024020704
item.description:
Report X-2024020704

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-29
  • City: VICTORIA
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PH were unloading trailer when they discovered a hazmat that appeared to be very wet. PH called out for a damaged hazmat and QA took the package to hazmat cage for inspection. Upon QA inspection it was discovered that the caps to 2 of the gallons of menthol were loose and had caused a leakage of 1.5 Gallons. DescribePack: Loose caps. Leakage DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a hazardous waste only bin and removed from unload to hazmat cage for inspection.

item.title: Report X-2024020387
item.description:
Report X-2024020387

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-19
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was IB Scanned and sent into the overhead sorter, it was diverted to the ADM and due to weight came down chute and shot off the rollers and hit the ground and spilled on the admin that was working the area. This was reported to management. spilled contents swept up and placed in plastic Hazmat bag and tote for containment. DescribePack: there is a large crack at the upper portion on the plastic pale. It is about 3inches in length.1 DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in hazmat bag and tote

HazMat certified operator was called to handle the material properly for damage process. DescribePack: Steel drum dropped from trailer to conveyor causing dent, puncture, and leaking base of cylinder DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Steel drum placed in Hazardous waste bag into FedEx approved Haz tote.

item.title: Report X-2024020277
item.description:
Report X-2024020277

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-09
  • City: VICTORIA
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2024020277 SequenceEvent: IB scanner noticed a spill in belly of the trailer. Notified unload OPM and OPM saw it was a hazmat. OPM placed Hazmat in a tot and placed in hazmat cage. OPM and Ops admin cleaned up spill and damaged package. DescribePack: Plastic drum cracked along the side of drum. 9" crack ran along the side of the drum. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Placed in tot and placed in hazmat cage. X-2024020274 SequenceEvent: IB scanner noticed spill in belly of trailer. Notified OPM of spill and OPM noticed it was a Hazmat. Upon inspection drum had cracked and leaked in belly of the trailer. OPM took damaged hazmat to Hazmat cage and OPM and OPs admin worked on damaged packages and clean up. DescribePack: Plastic drum cracked DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: OPM put drums in tots and moved to hazmat cage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Inbound trailer unload on preload, Segregated package was sent to QA for Inspection. Inspection found one missing 1 gallon jug and 3 - 1 gallon jugs with loose lids. DescribePack: The package was wet due to leakage of contents. The side of the package torn and ruptured. DurationRel: 7 and MitigateEffect: The package was secured in a plastic tote with a double bagged liner. Then relocated to the QA department.

item.title: Report I-2024020014
item.description:
Report I-2024020014

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-27
  • City: DFW
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: QATAR AIRWAYS CARGO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A package was tendered by forwarder DHL to Qatar Airways in DFW under MAWB 157-89110081 declared as consolidation. Actual contents were medical equipment and accessories per HAWB description which contained lithium ion batteries. It was not booked as an ELI shipment as it was supposed to but had an ELI label and PSN written on package. Upon acceptance and build up GHA where house staff failed to notice the ELI label and the PSN. As a result it was manifested and forwarded as general cargo on flight QR730/24Jan DFWDOH. Upon arrival of flight in Doha, it was discovered as a undeclared battery shipment. Shipment was held in Doha until proper documents were furnished to match package contents and labeling. Report filed with local CAA.

item.title: Report X-2024020274
item.description:
Report X-2024020274

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-09
  • City: VICTORIA
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2024020274 SequenceEvent: IB scanner noticed spill in belly of trailer. Notified OPM of spill and OPM noticed it was a Hazmat. Upon inspection drum had cracked and leaked in belly of the trailer. OPM took damaged hazmat to Hazmat cage and OPM and OPs admin worked on damaged packages and clean up. DescribePack: Plastic drum cracked DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: OPM put drums in tots and moved to hazmat cage. X-2024020277 SequenceEvent: IB scanner noticed a spill in belly of the trailer. Notified unload OPM and OPM saw it was a hazmat. OPM placed Hazmat in a tot and placed in hazmat cage. OPM and Ops admin cleaned up spill and damaged package. DescribePack: Plastic drum cracked along the side of drum. 9" crack ran along the side of the drum. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Placed in tot and placed in hazmat cage.
